Lonely Roads #14, Mo

Posted on April 7, 2012 by mike

OK…I’ve got to apologize a bit for not going complete in order. But, a couple different friends of mine actually shot prior to Stacy’s initial Lonely Road shoot on New Years Eve Day, Dec. 31, 2007. But, at that time…I didn’t have the “Lonely” project finalized and/or planned out…so I thus add these gals out of order. And, my lovely friend I’m posting today is Moria!
She’s been a friend of mine for years and is such a gem! Always game for any adventure out there and completely beautiful to boot. So, with the ongoing assistance of my buddy/mentor, Scott Cook, Moria when out and shot with me atop a drainage pipe in Hood River, OR on October 14, 2007. I was already playing with the concepts of color & motion but hadn’t yet set my sites on using roads as the foreground. So, LOL, when I went back to see this shoot, I loved how the drainage pipe was like a road in itself.

Anyway, Mo isn’t a model…though she easily could be. She’s an athlete, entrepreneur, traveler, greenhouse-owning incredible person. And, dress her in a yellow maple leaf and some tennis shoes and life is grand! We chose a killer fall day in that part of the world, too, as the vibrant shadesÂ of the leaves changing was remarkable. Well…enjoy my friend, Moria, and her drainage dreamscape!



Also, I forgot to tell you that one shot taken from Moria’s traintrack shoot made my book as well, on Page 45. But, you’ll have to getÂ “The Lonely Road” Â to see it! GET IT! ðŸ™‚
